commands.name: az network route-filter create
commands.syntax:
az network route-filter create --name
                               --resource-group
                               [--location]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--tags]
examples: az network route-filter create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteFilter
az network route-filter create --location westus2 --name MyRouteFilter --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network route-filter delete
commands.syntax:
az network route-filter delete [--ids]
                               [--name]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--subscription]
examples: az network route-filter delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteFilter

commands.name: az network route-filter show
commands.summary: Get the details of a route filter.
examples: az network route-filter show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteFilter
az network route-filter show --expand peerings --name MyRouteFilter --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network route-filter update
commands.syntax:
az network route-filter update [--add]
                               [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--ids]
                               [--location]
                               [--name]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--remove]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--set]
                               [--subscription]
                               [--tags]
examples: az network route-filter update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyRouteFilter --set tags.CostCenter=MyBusinessGroup

commands.name: az network route-filter wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
